intro: Hieracium sagittatum subsp. submoeanum, commonly known as the arrowhead hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to central and eastern Europe, often found in meadows and grassy areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
